p: In addition to the T-cell/monocyte-recruiting CCL2, upregulation of proinflammatory chemokine CCL5, also known as RANTES (Regulated on Activation, Normal T-Cell Expressed and Secreted), is also commonly observed in the context of neuroinflammation. Both neurons and astrocytes have shown to be the source of CCL5 in WNV infection [ 19]. ZIKV and tick-borne encephalitis virus (TBEV), another neurotropic flavivirus endemic to Europe and the far east, also have been reported to induce CCL5 production in human primary astrocytes [ 22, 23 â–ª ].
